This is a curated compilation, as a supplement to JavaScript Interview Questions

Every now an then I bump into a great career tip, a job search site, or an excellent article.
Here, I will list those links and resources that may be beneficial for your career development.

Never forget that anyone can learn how to be a decent coder.

Being a great professional, however, requires much more than just being able to code.

And my hope is that these links will help you be the rockstar you wanna be, and land your dream job.

Ah and… this is a wiki page, which means that you can edit it, and add your useful resources too.

Closely Follow the Future of JavaScript

I’m hearing that more and more interviews are starting to include questions likeâ€¦

  • “How do you envision the next version of JavaScript?”
  • “If you want to add something new to the language, what would that be? Or if you want to remove something, what would it be?”
  • “If something replaces JavaScript, how would that look like?”

Meaning: the decision-makers are nowadays more and more interested in how the future would look like (wrt: es6, es7, web components, web assembly, reactive programming, native promises, service workers, fat arrows, es6 modules and stuff like thatâ€¦)

You should pay attention to them too ;)
